title: Authors and Citation
text: Aswin Singaram Natarajan. Author, maintainer. Todd Collins. Author, contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Singaram Natarajan , Collins T (2024). plotPlotR: Field experiment plot creation, segmentation manipulation. R package version 0.1.6, https://sin17m.github.io/plotPlotR/, https://github.com/sin17m/plotplotr.
code: @Manual{,   title = {plotPlotR: Field experiment plot creation, segmentation and manipulation},   author = {Aswin {Singaram Natarajan} and Todd Collins},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.6, https://sin17m.github.io/plotPlotR/},   url = {https://github.com/sin17m/plotplotr}, }

title: plotPlotR
text: plotPlotR referring plot plotter package containing set functions create plots field trial segements boundaries field experiment. functions heavily based “sf” package little bit dplyr magrittr. package provides functions simple R users, may familiar spatial data want functions can used easily, repeatedly. hope package update regularly functions added.

title: plotPlotR
text: plotPlotR can installed locally devtools::install_github("https://github.com/sin17m/plotplotr")

what: Add Run and Range values to a field experiment plots — addRunRange
title: Add Run and Range values to a field experiment plots — addRunRange
text: generating plot boundaries, functions allows users assign Run Range values. identify () run1_range1 value, assume standing **Southern end** **experiment width** side .e. `exp_width` input `corners_to_plot` function, facing Northern end. Bottom close , Top away . Left left side Right right side.

title: Add Run and Range values to a field experiment plots — addRunRange
Add Run and Range values to a field experiment plots — addRunRange
text: sf_object sf object geometry type POLYGON MULTIPOLYGON run1_range1 Position Run 1 Range 1. take 4 different options. "TR","TL","BR","BL" denoting top right, top left, bottom right, bottom left respectively.

title: Add Run and Range values to a field experiment plots — addRunRange
text: sf object Run Range columns added.

title: Add Run and Range values to a field experiment plots — addRunRange
code: a <- corners_to_plots(sf_object = cornersData,                       exp_length = 80, exp_width = 24.2,                       n_runs = 11, n_ranges = 20)  a_w_RunRange <- addRunRange(a, "BL")

what: A data frame containing 4 XY coordinates and a id variable — cornersData
title: A data frame containing 4 XY coordinates and a id variable — cornersData
text: XY coordinates WGS84 EPSG:4326 field experiment Australia. Data originally recorded csv format.

title: A data frame containing 4 XY coordinates and a id variable — cornersData
A data frame containing 4 XY coordinates and a id variable — cornersData
text: data frame 4 rows 3 columns: X Longitude Y Latitude id id

what: Generating plots from four corner points — corners_to_plots
title: Generating plots from four corner points — corners_to_plots
text: functions takes sf object similar 4 corners field experiment, find center rotation angle, make new plots based parameters produces sf object geometry type MULTIPOLYGON. Recommended use CRS unit meters, see function `wgs84_to_unitM()`

title: Generating plots from four corner points — corners_to_plots
Generating plots from four corner points — corners_to_plots
text: sf_object sf object geometry 4 POINTS data frame four rows X,Y (Longitude Latitude) exp_length Total length experiment unit meter exp_width Total width experiment unit meter n_runs Number runs experiment, typically along shorter side experiment. n_ranges Number ranges experiment, typically along longer side experiment.

title: Generating plots from four corner points — corners_to_plots
text: sf object geometry MULTIPOLYGON n_runs X n_ranges features.

title: Generating plots from four corner points — corners_to_plots

what: Find offsets to move plots horizontally and,or vertically — find_offsets
title: Find offsets to move plots horizontally and,or vertically — find_offsets
text: Produces 1 plot unit offset values moving plots horizontally vertically.

title: Find offsets to move plots horizontally and,or vertically — find_offsets
Find offsets to move plots horizontally and,or vertically — find_offsets
text: sf_object sf object geometry POINT POLYGON Run Range fields

title: Find offsets to move plots horizontally and,or vertically — find_offsets
text: matrix X Y offsets horizontal vertical shifts

title: Find offsets to move plots horizontally and,or vertically — find_offsets

what: Multi-corner points to 4 corner points — multicorners_to_4corners
title: Multi-corner points to 4 corner points — multicorners_to_4corners
text: increase accuracy finding center point field experiment, users can use function multiple points corner collected. function use points find average corner points improve precision center.

title: Multi-corner points to 4 corner points — multicorners_to_4corners
Multi-corner points to 4 corner points — multicorners_to_4corners
text: sf_object sf object data frame three columns, geometry id column group corners. data frame needs contain columns Longitude, Latitude id.

title: Multi-corner points to 4 corner points — multicorners_to_4corners
text: sf object 4 points

title: radian to degree — rad_2_deg
text: Convert radians degree angle.

title: radian to degree — rad_2_deg
radian to degree — rad_2_deg
text: rad_value Rotation angle radian.

title: radian to degree — rad_2_deg
text: numeric value degree angle. Values Zero 360.

what: Orientation of field experiment layout — rot_angle
title: Orientation of field experiment layout — rot_angle
text: function takes sf object geometry MULTIPOLYGON POINT find rotation center. example, perfect North facing field experiment rotation Zero degrees, East 90 degrees . Make sure data Longitude X Latitude Y order

title: Orientation of field experiment layout — rot_angle
Orientation of field experiment layout — rot_angle
text: sf_object sf object geometry MULTIPOLYGON POINT, data frame 4 XY

title: Orientation of field experiment layout — rot_angle
text: numeric value angle radians

title: Orientation of field experiment layout — rot_angle

what: Rotate individual plots on its center — rot_plots
title: Rotate individual plots on its center — rot_plots
text: Rotate individual plots center

title: Rotate individual plots on its center — rot_plots
Rotate individual plots on its center — rot_plots
text: sf_object MULTIPOLYGON sf object, representing plots field experiment. rotation_angle Rotation angle radians. Use function rot_angle() find rotation angle pass radians numeric input.

title: Rotate individual plots on its center — rot_plots
text: Returns rotated sf object

what: Rotate an entire sf object — rot_shape
title: Rotate an entire sf object — rot_shape
text: Rotate entire sf object

title: Rotate an entire sf object — rot_shape
Rotate an entire sf object — rot_shape
text: rot_angle rotation angle radians

title: Rotate an entire sf object — rot_shape
text: Rotated sf object

what: Converting coordinate to a unit M CRS — wgs84_to_unitM
title: Converting coordinate to a unit M CRS — wgs84_to_unitM
text: Converting coordinate unit M CRS

title: Converting coordinate to a unit M CRS — wgs84_to_unitM
Converting coordinate to a unit M CRS — wgs84_to_unitM
text: sf_object sf object data frame X Y columns containing Longitude Latitude data CRSinMeters CRS unit M. Check epsg.io find appropriate CRS location

title: Converting coordinate to a unit M CRS — wgs84_to_unitM
text: sf unit M CRS

title: Converting coordinate to a unit M CRS — wgs84_to_unitM
code: wgs84_to_unitM(cornersData, 28355) #> Simple feature collection with 4 features and 1 field #> Geometry type: POINT #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 654927.998739682 ymin: 6184366.27196296 xmax: 654957.323510782 ymax: 6184447.16518589 #> Projected CRS: GDA94 / MGA zone 55 #>   id                       geometry #> 1  1 POINT (654934.1128626604331... #> 2  4 POINT (654957.3235107820946... #> 3  2 POINT (654927.9987396819051... #> 4  3 POINT (654951.0726821878925...

title: plotPlotR 0.1.0
text: Initial CRAN submission.
